revised_title: Comparative Analysis of Cortex Cerebri Structure in Various Mammals
tldr: The author examines the structure of the cortex cerebri in various mammals, including pigs, sheep, cats, ocelots, and Barbary apes, and compares the results with the human brain. The study focuses on the six-laminated and five-laminated cortex types and their differences in cellular conformation and distribution. The findings suggest that the anatomical structure of the cortex is related to the complexity and independence of motor functions in different species.
